Exco PSSI Evaluasi Ratu Tisha, Nasibnya Diumumkan Desember
03 Nov 2019, 04:25 by Antara, Nurdin Saleh
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Komite Eksekutif (Exco) PSSI akan mengevaluasi kinerja sekretaris jenderal PSSI Ratu Tisha Destria selama menjabat pada tahun 2017-2019. Hal itu disampaikan Ketua Umum PSSI Komisaris Jenderal Polisi Mochamad Iriawan.
Menurut pria yang akrab disapa Iwan Bule itu, hasil evaluasi akan diumumkan pada Desember 2019. Saat itu diputuskan apakah Ratu Tisha tetap menjabat sekjen untuk periode 2019-2023 atau tidak.
“Apakah Ibu Ratu Tisha akan diganti atau tidak, kami akan mengevaluasinya. Dalam sebulan ke depan sudah ada keputusan,” kata Iwan usai kongres luar biasa (KLB) PSSI di Hotel Shangri-La, Jakarta, Sabtu.
PSSI baru menetapkan 15 nama di jajaran Komite Eksekutif (Exco) untuk periode 2019-2023 dalam kongres luar biasa (KLB) yang berlangsung di Hotel Shangri-La, Jakarta, Sabtu malam.
Para Exco tersebut merupakan ketua umum, dua wakil ketua umum, dan 12 anggota exco. Namun, belum ada keputusan apakah ada pergantian di posisi sekretaris jenderal yang saat ini dijabat oleh Ratu Tisha Destria.
Ratu Tisha Destria menjadi Sekjen menggantikan Ade Wellington setelah lolos seleksi terbuka yang digelar PSSI pada tahun 2017 dan namanya disahkan dalam rapat Exco. Di PSSI, tidak seperti Komite Eksekutif yang dipilih berdasarkan pemungutan suara, penunjukan sekjen dilakukan oleh Exco.
Selama menjalani tugasnya sebagai sekjen, Ratu Tisha membuat catatan positif dalam kariernya. Dia merupakan sekjen perempuan pertama sepanjang sejarah PSSI. Lulusan FIFA Master ini juga menjadi Wakil Presiden Federasi Sepak Bola ASEAN (AFF) 2019-2023, juga menjadi perempuan pertama di posisi tersebut.
Di Konfederasi Sepak Bola Asia (AFC), Ratu Tisha menjadi salah satu anggota Komite Kompetisi.
Menurut Ratu Tisha, selama belum ada keputusan pergantian sekjen, dirinya masih melakukan tugasnya sebagai Sekjen PSSI. Dia pun siap jika kembali ditunjuk oleh Exco menjadi pemimpin di kesekretariatan PSSI. “Saya siap mengemban amanah,” tutur dia.

Exco PSSI Evaluation of Ratu Tisha, her fate announced in December
03 Nov 2019, 04:25 by Antara, Nurdin Saleh
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - PSSI Executive Committee (Exco) will evaluate the performance of PSSI secretary general Ratu Tisha Destria during her tenure in 2017-2019. That was said by PSSI General Chairman Commissioner General of Police Mochamad Iriawan.
According to the man who is familiarly called Iwan Bule, the evaluation results will be announced in December 2019. At that time it was decided whether Ratu Tisha remained as secretary general for the period 2019-2023 or not.
"Whether Queen Tisha will be replaced or not, we will evaluate it. In the next month there has been a decision, "Iwan said after the extraordinary PSSI congress (KLB) at the Shangri-La Hotel, Jakarta, Saturday.
PSSI has just set 15 names in the ranks of the Executive Committee (Exco) for the 2019-2023 period in the extraordinary congress (KLB) which took place at the Shangri-La Hotel, Jakarta, Saturday night.
The Exco are the general chairperson, two deputy chairmen, and 12 exco members. However, there has been no decision whether there is a change in the position of secretary general who is currently held by Queen Tisha Destria.
Ratu Tisha Destria became the Secretary General to replace Ade Wellington after passing the open selection held by PSSI in 2017 and her name was validated at an Exco meeting. At PSSI, unlike the Executive Committee chosen by vote, the appointment of the secretary general is carried out by Exco.
During her duties as secretary general, Ratu Tisha made a positive note in her career. She is the first female secretary general in the history of PSSI. This FIFA Master graduate also became Vice President of the ASEAN Football Federation (AFF) 2019-2023, also becoming the first woman in that position.
At the Asian Football Confederation (AFC), Ratu Tisha became a member of the Competition Committee.
According to Ratu Tisha, as long as there has not been a decision to replace the secretary general, he is still carrying out his duties as Secretary General of PSSI. He was ready if he was reappointed by Exco to be the leader in the PSSI secretariat. "I am ready to carry out the mandate," he said.
